quotes.text: I got everything from someone. Nobody can be original.
quotes.author: Philip Johnson

quotes.text: Less is only more where more is no good.
quotes.author: Frank LLoyd Wright

quotes.text: The object of education is not to fill a man's mind with facts; it is to teach him how to use his mind in thinking.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.text: Falsehood is never in words; it is in things.
quotes.author: Italo Calvino

quotes.text: It doesn't make a damned bit of difference who wins the war to someone who's dead.
quotes.author: Joseph Heller

quotes.text: You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.text: Time is a great teacher, but unfortunately it kills all its pupils.
quotes.author: Louis Hector Berlioz

quotes.text: Writing about music is like dancing about architecture.
quotes.author: Martin Mull

quotes.text: Look up to the sky. You'll never find rainbows if you’re looking down.
quotes.author: Charlie Chaplin

quotes.text: Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly, and applying the wrong remedies.
quotes.author: Sir Ernest Benn

quotes.text: I don’t want to belong to any club that will accept me as a member.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: The strength of the structure has nothing to do with the strength of the material.
quotes.author: Shigeru Ban

quotes.text: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work in hand. The Sun's rays do not burn until brought to a focus.
quotes.author: Alexander Graham Bell

quotes.text: He who studies without passion will never become anything more than a pedant.
quotes.author: Stefan Zweig

quotes.text: The only kind of education worth while is self-education.
quotes.author: Charles Swain Thomas

quotes.text: The wonderful thing about standards is that there are so many of them to choose from.
quotes.author: Grace Murray Hopper

quotes.text: In private life I'm stutterer, but when there are other people I'm ashamed so I speak well.
quotes.author: Nino Frassica

quotes.text: If knowledge can create problems, it is not through ignorance that we can solve them.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.text: To be an artist you have to give up everything, including the desire to be a good artist.
quotes.author: Jasper Johns

quotes.text: Barking dogs never sleep.
quotes.author: Nino Frassica

quotes.text: What are books but folly, and what is an education but an arrant hypocrisy, and what is art but a curse when they touch not the heart and impel it not to action?
quotes.author: Louis Sullivan

quotes.text: You can't lose your nerve for the big failure because you need exactly the same nerve for the big success.
quotes.author: Regina E. Dugan

quotes.text: We shouldn't be looking for heroes, we should be looking for good ideas.
quotes.author: Noam Chomsky

quotes.text: If the result confirms the hypothesis, then you've made a measurement. If the result is contrary to the hypothesis, then you've made a discovery.
quotes.author: Enrico Fermi

quotes.text: That men do not learn very much from the lessons of history is the most important of all the lessons that history has to teach.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley
